body.p: Suppose your friends have the following ice cream flavor preferences:

li.p: 70% of your friends like chocolate (C). The remaining do not like chocolate.
40% of your friends like sprinkles (S) topping. The remaining do not like sprinkles.
25% of your friends who like Chocolate (C) also like sprinkles (S).

body.p: Of the friends who like sprinkles, what proportion of this group likes chocolate? (Note: Some answers are rounded to two decimal places.)

feedback.p: Incorrect. In general, P (S and C) * P (S) has no useful meaning. Recall that you should be finding P( C | S), the proportion of friends who like chocolate given that they like sprinkles.

Incorrect. It seems that you have incorrectly assumed that C and S are independent events and calculated P (C and S) rather than calculating the proportion of friends who like chocolate given that they like sprinkles, P( C | S).
